name: Bootstrap 3
description: Bootstrap 3 quick explanation of Classes like Helper Classes, Carousel, Alerts, Badges, Buttons and much more.

Helper Classes.val: Similar to the contextual text color classes, easily set the background of an element to any contextual class. Anchor components will darken on hover, just like the text classes.
Similar to the contextual text color classes, easily set the background of an element to any contextual class. Anchor components will darken on hover, just like the text classes.
Similar to the contextual text color classes, easily set the background of an element to any contextual class. Anchor components will darken on hover, just like the text classes.
Similar to the contextual text color classes, easily set the background of an element to any contextual class. Anchor components will darken on hover, just like the text classes.
Similar to the contextual text color classes, easily set the background of an element to any contextual class. Anchor components will darken on hover, just like the text classes.
add width and height to center a block level element.
Used to clear floats by adding .cleafix to the parent element. It adds a pseudo element with clear:both property.
Use the generic close icon for dismissing content like modals and alerts.
this class is the same as hidden but is deprecated so use .hidden instead.
Hide an element to all devices except screen readers with .sr-only.

Carousel.val: parent carousel class making it position relative.
Added to each next and previous anchors.
parent classed added to an ordered list for the little circles showing what slide you are on.
The div wrapper that contains the carousel slide items.

Glyphicon icons not necessary - The .glyphicon .glyphicon-chevron-left and .glyphicon .glyphicon-chevron-right classes are not necessarily needed for the controls. Bootstrap provides .icon-prev and .icon-next as plain unicode alternatives.

Glyphicon icons not necessary - The .glyphicon .glyphicon-chevron-left and .glyphicon .glyphicon-chevron-right classes are not necessarily needed for the controls. Bootstrap provides .icon-prev and .icon-next as plain unicode alternatives.
Class added to each carousel item.
Used to identify the left carousel control.
Used in the carousel control to identity the next control.
Used in the carousel component for previous link.

Alerts.val: Similar to a well it is a box with a border and padding. The .alert class adds the padding and margin.
Similar to a well it is a box with a border and padding. The .alert class adds the padding and margin. Defaults as red background color.
Similar to a well it is a box with a border and padding. This class and a child element with a .close class lets the user close the alert.
Similar to a well it is a box with a border and padding. The .alert class adds the padding and margin. Defaults as blue background color.
When you add links inside alert this class matches the font color to the parent alert class.
Similar to a well it is a box with a border and padding. The .alert class adds the padding and margin. Defaults as green background color.
Similar to a well it is a box with a border and padding. The .alert class adds the padding and margin. Defaults as yellow background color.
To have your alerts use animation when closing, make sure they have the .fade and .in classes already applied to them.

Badges.val: Makes terms and definitions line up with a center gutter.
Used to show new or unread messages or items like the iOS red icon showing new messages or email.

Buttons.val: This class sets the spacing and size of the button.
By default buttons are inline this class makes it block to span the full width of its parent.
Defaults to a red background button.
Defaults to a white background button with dark border.
Make a group of buttons stretch at equal sizes to span the entire width of its parent. Also works with button dropdowns within the button group.
Make a set of buttons appear vertically stacked rather than horizontally.
Button for information on a topic like terms and conditions. Default is light blue.
Keeps the spacing set with the .btn class but removes the outer border.
Use for the primary action in a set.
Fancy larger or smaller buttons? Add .btn-lg, .btn-sm, or .btn-xs for additional sizes.
Fancy larger or smaller buttons? Add .btn-lg, .btn-sm, or .btn-xs for additional sizes.
Defaults to a green background button with dark border.
Defaults to a yellow background button with dark border.
Fancy larger or smaller buttons? Add .btn-lg, .btn-sm, or .btn-xs for additional sizes.
Attaches a button next to a text input. Would work for a search bar or email optin form.

Dropdowns.val: Used in dropdown menus to show open and closed states.
Used to separate links in dropdown menus a.
This class gives you the ability to add a dropdown to navbar, tabs, and pills so you can display a dropdown of additional navigation.

On mobile devices, opening a dropdown adds a .dropdown-backdrop as a tap area for closing dropdown menus when tapping outside the menu, a requirement for proper iOS support. This means that switching from an open dropdown menu to a different dropdown menu requires an extra tap on mobile.
Used to add headers inside the dropdown menu.
Adds the default styles for the dropdown menu container.
This class is added to the button that will have the toggle action applied that will hide and show the dropdown menu.

Grid system.val: span 1-12 column. Extra small devices Phones ( < 768px), Small devices Tablets (≥768px), Medium devices Desktops (≥992px), Large devices Desktops (≥1200px). Column device Column numeric values can be 1-12.

Move columns to the right using .col-lg-offset-* classes. These classes increase the left margin of a column by * columns. For example, .col-lg-offset-4 moves .col-lg-4 over four columns. Offset numeric values can be 0-12
Easily change the order of our built-in grid columns with .col-*-push-* and .col-*-pull-* modifier classes. Pull numeric values can be 0-12.
Easily change the order of our built-in grid columns with .col-*-push-* and .col-*-pull-* modifier classes. Push numeric values can be 0-12.
used a parent wrapper of any vertical columns.

Responsive embed.val: The default responsive iframe embed styles.
Div wrapper class to make child iframe responsive.
Div wrapper class to make child iframe responsive.

Responsive Utilities.val: Use a single or combination of the available classes for toggling content across viewport breakpoints. Can us lg, md, sm. xs
Similar to the regular responsive classes, use these for toggling content for print.
Use a single or combination of the available classes for toggling content across viewport breakpoints.
Use a single or combination of the available classes for toggling content across viewport breakpoints.
Use a single or combination of the available classes for toggling content across viewport breakpoints.
Use a single or combination of the available classes for toggling content across viewport breakpoints.

Forms.val: In forms this classes is added to form labels to allow the label to be used for form validation
Class added input, textarea, and select to make them 100% and responsive.
Lets you add plain text to the right of a label. For example, Email label could have help text.
A div wrapper class that goes around a form input and label.
You can also add optional feedback icons with the addition of .has-feedback and the right icon.
A block of help text that breaks onto a new line and may extend beyond one line.
Set heights using classes like .input-lg, and set widths using grid column classes like .col-lg-*.
Set heights using classes like .input-lg, and set widths using grid column classes like .col-lg-*.

Tables.val: Tables contextual class to change row color.
Tables contextual class to change row color.
Tables contextual class to change row color
Tables contextual class to change row color.
Adding this class to a HTML table applies the Bootstrap styles.
Removes some padding from the table cells.
Adds borders to a table and its cells.
Makes a table responsive by cropping a wide table and makes it scrollable horizontally.
Tables contextual class to change row color.

Glyphicons.val: Base icon font styling for icon font
Class to add chevron icon to the right.
Class to add chevron icon to the right

Images.val: Crops an image to be a circle.
Adds rounded corners to an image.
Adds rounded corners and an inset border to an image.

Typography.val: Apply heading styles to other elements. Make a paragraph look like an h1.
Add .initialism to an abbreviation for a slightly smaller font-size.
Increase the font size and line height of a paragraph. Good to use on the first paragraph of an article to improve readability.
Create lighter, secondary text in any heading with a generic tag or the .small class.
Capitalize the text or title case.
Aligns the text to the center.
hides the text - useful for replacing text with a background image.

Labels.val: Change color of the label by adding one of the following: default, warning, info, danger, primary.

List group.val: Wrapper ul class that contains li with borders.
Class added to each li in a list-group.
Class added to each li in a list-group.
Class added to each li in a list-group.

Labels.val: Change color of the label by adding one of the following: default, warning, info, danger, primary.
